line_1: O'er the gay banks of silver Clyde,
Among the sunny shallows of the Clyde
line_2: Then as we paddled barefoot, side by side,

line_1: Where, spread in broad and fair expanse, the Clyde
line_2: Mingles his waters with the briny tide,

line_1: Where EVAN mingles with the CLYDE.
line_2: All, all my hopes of bliss reside

line_1: Muse, while the EVAN meets the CLYDE?
line_2: Or where yon grot o'erhangs the tide,

line_1: Blest stream! — she views thee haste to CLYDE!
line_2: Sweet banks! — ye bloom by MARY'S side!

line_1: From that dear stream which flows to CLYDE.
line_2: Nor more may aught my steps divide

line_1: Her name was Mary, from the banks of Clyde,
line_2: She came to taste the summer in its pride.
